Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Pot with a spherical body, with a wide neckless orifice and a double lip with an S-profile. The common black clay has oxidised on the surface and is therefore red-orange with a small black rim on the outside, which has been simply polished. This shape is a late example of the large decorated jars of the Middle Kerma.
